ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying in the Sakyan country at Kapilavatthu in the Banyan Tree Monastery.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.2_0: the slaves of the Sakyans were rebelling.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.3_0: The Sakyan women wished to prepare a meal at the wilderness dwellings,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.4_0: but the slaves heard about this
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.5_0: “They came to us in the wilderness dwellings and designated meals.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.7_0: When the Sakyan women took various kinds of nice food and set out for a wilderness dwelling,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.8_0: the slaves emerged, and they robbed and raped those Sakyan women.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.9_0: The Sakyans left the house and complained and criticized them,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.10_0: “How can they not announce that there are criminals staying in the monastery?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.11_0: The monks heard the complaints of the Sakyans
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.13_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.14_0: “Well then, monks, I will lay down a training rule for the following ten reasons: for the well-being of the Sangha, for the comfort of the Sangha, for the restraint of bad people, for the ease of well-behaved monks, for the restraint of corruptions relating to the present life, for the restraint of corruptions relating to future lives, to give rise to confidence in those without it, to increase the confidence of those who have it, for the longevity of the true Teaching, and for supporting the training.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.15_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.16.1_0: ‘There are wilderness dwellings that are considered risky and dangerous. If a monk, without first making an announcement about those dwellings, eats staple or non-staple food after personally receiving it inside that monastery, he must acknowledge it:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.17_0: “I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.18_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.1_0: Soon afterwards a monk in a wilderness dwelling was sick.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.2_0: People took staple and non-staple food and went to that wilderness dwelling,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.3_0: and so they invited him to eat.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.6_0: Knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating meals in a wilderness dwelling, and being afraid of wrongdoing, he did not accept.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.8_0: They in turn told the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.9_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.10_0: “Monks, I allow a sick monk to receive staple or non-staple food after personally receiving it directly from a wilderness dwelling without first being invited.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.11_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.12.1_0: ‘There are wilderness dwellings that are considered risky and dangerous. If a monk, without first making an announcement about those dwellings, eats staple or non-staple food after personally receiving it inside that monastery, he must acknowledge it:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.13_0: “I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.2_0: a wilderness dwelling: if it is at least 800 meters away from any inhabited area.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.4_0: in the monastery, or in the vicinity of the monastery, thieves have been seen camping, eating, standing, seated, or lying down.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.6_0: in the monastery, or in the vicinity of the monastery, criminals have been seen injuring, robbing, or beating people.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.10_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.14_0: if an announcement is made to any of one’s five co-monastics, this is called “without making an announcement”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.15_0: If an announcement is made about anything apart from the monastery or its vicinity, this is called “without making an announcement”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.17_0: if a woman or a man comes to the monastery or the vicinity of the monastery and says, “Venerable, they’ll bring so-and-so’s staple or non-staple food,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.17_1: If she is suspected, he should tell him,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.17_2: If there is someone who is dangerous and fearful, he should point him out.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.18_0: If the person says, “Never mind, it will be brought,” then the criminals are to be told, “People are coming here; go away.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.19_0: When an announcement has been made in regard to rice porridge, and accompanying food is brought, this is called “announced”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.20_0: When an announcement has been made in regard to rice, and accompanying food is brought, this is called “announced”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.21_0: When an announcement has been made in regard to rice, and accompanying food is brought, this is called “announced”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.22_0: When an announcement has been made in regard to a particular family, then when any person from that family brings staple or non-staple food, this is called “announced”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.23_0: When an announcement has been made in regard to a particular village, then when any person from that village or town, this is called “announced”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.24_0: When an announcement has been made in regard to a particular association, then when any person from that association brings staple or non-staple food, this is called “announced”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.26_0: apart from the five staple foods, the post-midday tonics, the seven-day tonics, and the lifetime tonics—the rest is called “non-staple food”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.28_0: there are five kinds of staple food: cooked grain, porridge, flour, fish, and meat.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.33_0: who is able to walk for alms.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.35_0: who is unable to walk for alms.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.36_0: If, without making an announcement, one who is not sick receives staple and non-staple food with the intention of eating it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.37_0: For every mouthful, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.38.1_0: If there has been no announcement, but he does not perceive that there has, and he, not being sick, eats staple or non-staple food after personally receiving it inside that monastery, then he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.39_0: If there has been no announcement, but he is unsure of it, and he, not being sick, eats staple or non-staple food after personally receiving it inside that monastery, then he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.40_0: If there has been no announcement, but he perceives that there has, and he, not being sick, eats staple or non-staple food after personally receiving it inside that monastery, then he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.41_0: If he receives post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics for the purpose of food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.42_0: For every mouthful, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.43_0: If there has been an announcement, but he does not perceive that there has, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.44_0: If there has been an announcement, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.45_0: If he has been announced, and he perceives it as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.4_0: if he eats the leftovers from where there has been an announcement or from one who is sick;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.5_0: if he receives the food outside the monastery and then eats it inside;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.6_0: if he eats a root, bark, a leaf, a flower, or a fruit originating in that monastery;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.7_0: if, when there is a reason, he uses post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.9_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.10_0: The fourth training rule on acknowledgment is finished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.11_0: “Venerables, the four rules on acknowledgment have been recited.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.12_0: In regard to this I ask you,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.18_0: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I will remember it thus.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.19_0: The chapter on offenses entailing acknowledgment is finished.
